column4: Hi everyone. Is there anyone who can help me find a working usb tv capturing device that works with GNU/Linux?
it's difficult to know before you've tried. Internals tend to change while model names stay the same.
Do you have tried any?
I've tried a noname device with a Dibcom chipset which works with kernel 2.6.18 and above
I've also tried the MSI-580 (most popular one at the moment I believe), which doesn't work so well.
Okay. I guess I will go for a            TerraTec Cinergy T USB XE which will maybe work (according to some...).
I think Linux really needs a good hardware compatabillity list which list distribution/kernel for each hardware *-)
perhaps you can order from a dealer who will give you a no-quibbles exchange
Perhaps but it's so little money *-). About 20
start compiling one, and you will soon learn why there isn't any ;)
compiling one?
I thought something like a user contributed hardware site.
compiling, as in gathering information (not the gcc sense)
something like tuxmobil for laptops?
I know that there are some out there but I would like one universal. For all Linux versions. All kernel versions/distributions.
Tell me about one... Which aint just for one thing (like laptops)
Which is universal.
Translated...
I don't know any. Back on your original question, I found this: http://www.linuxtv.org/wiki/index.php/Main_Page
Yeah but it's only for TV-related hardware. I thought something more complete which contains storage devices, network cards, sound cards, graphics cards etc.

Right now you'll have to search round and around in different databases to find something reliable, I don't say that Linux support is bad but I think the knowledge of which works and doesn't works should be contained in ONE database. I really hope something makes the move one day. Anyway, thanks for your help.
